com.yantra.api.inv

Interface adjustInventory

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.INVApi, YIFApi

    public interface adjustInventory

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document adjustInventory(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The adjustInventory API updates inventory data for a specific SupplyType.

    • Method Detail

      • adjustInventory

        org.w3c.dom.Document adjustInventory(YFSEnvironment env,
                                     org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                              throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                     java.rmi.RemoteException

        The adjustInventory API updates inventory data for a specific SupplyType. The inventory data changes are specified for a ShipNode.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        This API invokes the following user exits:

          com.yantra.ycm.japi.ue.YCMGetItemDetailsUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetAdjustmentDetailsUE is called only if FIFO based costing is enabled for the ShipNode and if an existing supply is found. The UE will not be triggered by the Average costing flag.
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetTagNoUE

        Events Raised:
        INVENTORY_CHANGE - This event is raised only for Inventory Organizations.

        Key Data: INVENTORY_CHANGE_INVENTORY_CHANGE_dbd.txt
        Data Published: INVENTORY_CHANGE_INVENTORY_CHANGE_dbd.txt

        SUPPLY_CHANGE_LIST

        Key Data: NONE
        Data Published: INV_INVENTORY_CHANGE.SUPPLY_CHANGE_LIST.html

        SUPPLY_CHANGE

        Key Data: INVENTORY_CHANGE_SUPPLY_CHANGE_dbd.txt
        Data Published: INV_INVENTORY_CHANGE.SUPPLY_CHANGE.html

        Template Support: No

        Following events are raised under transaction INVENTORY_COST_CHANGE.
        INVENTORY_VALUE_CHANGE:
          When inventory adjustment is done for an item at a fulfillment location this event is raised from inventory management with the inventory value change information for the fulfillment location.
          Data published - YFS_ADJUST_INVENTORY.INVENTORY_VALUE_CHANGE
          Key data - YFS_ADJUST_INVENTORY.INVENTORY_VALUE_CHANGE

      Template Support:
      No.
      Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility:
      N/A.
      INVENTORY_COST_CHANGE:
        When inventory adjustment is done for an item at a fulfillment location this event is raised from inventory management with the inventory cost change information for the fulfillment location.
        Data published - YFS_ADJUST_INVENTORY.INVENTORY_COST_CHANGE
        Key data - YFS_ADJUST_INVENTORY.INVENTORY_COST_CHANGE

    Template Support:
    No.
    Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility:
    N/A.

    Audits:
    Audits of supply types of the type onhand are maintained in the YFS_INVENTORY_AUDIT table. The attribute SequenceNo in YFS_INVENTORY_AUDIT ties it with WMS audits. All transactions in a transaction boundary are logged with same audit sequence in location inventory audit and corresponding inventory audits. This information is also published in the events INVENTORY_CHANGE and SUPPLY_CHANGE.
    Note that the event publishes the data even before the transaction gets commited. Integrations around these events should be mindful of this fact.

    Pre-conditions: None

    Post-conditions:
    The quantity information in the YFS_INVENTORY_SUPPLY table is updated for items that are specified in the input XML file.

    Output Template Support: No

    Database Extensibility Support: N/A

    Additional Information:
    InventoryCost is updated if the MaintainInventoryCost flag is enabled for the ShipNode and the FIFO costing method is selected.
    API throws error if availability is maintained externally for primary enterprise code of inventory organization or ShipNode.

Parameters:
env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
inXML - Required. Contains the inventory data. For more information on the inventory data, see the associated input xml files.

Returns:
Null.
Throws:
com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
